website_summaries.verdict: Those who would slip into the Vasque Breeze LT Low GTX are likely to be impressed with the shoe’s oozing amounts of comfort and incredible lightness. The hiker’s true-to-size fit and remarkably sticky outsole also make owning one a great pleasure. With all that said, the shoe might not appeal to users with bulky feet or buyers on a tight budget. In spite of some flaws, the Breeze LT Low GTX is promising, thanks to its combination of traits that matter on the trail.
pros: Several Vasque Breeze LT Low GTX buyers consider the shoe very comfortable
The hiker’s lengthwise fit is true to size, according to a few owners who have tried it
A couple of users say that its outsole is phenomenally grippy
Someone who has bought this Vasque hiking product testifies about its superbly lightweight construction
It has a super-quick break-in phase, says a tester who has taken it for a spin
An owner who has reviewed this lightweight trail boot finds it mesmerizingly eye-catching
cons: This Vasque hiker is unamusingly narrow, says a patron who has used it several times
The shoe’s rather high asking price may not be for the faint of heart

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight shoe. Seems like they would be very comfortable. Had to return. Order a half size up. Been wearing other Vasque's Breeze styles for 20 years. All fit my size except this one.
customer_reviews.author: BCW

customer_reviews.title: I don't see the hype on these.
customer_reviews.text: Fits as expected, however, once I have the shoes on and started to walk I noticed my heels keep sliding up and it seems the gore-tex material has a slippery surface. Also, at the heel where the gore-tex meets the inside shoe fabric, that sewing digs into my heel as well and is very uncomfortable. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: nzbc

customer_reviews.title: Amazing so far
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I had a pair of there hiking boots when I was younger ,the lasted forever . These feel so good , and the cleated Vibram sole is great , don’t feel all the rough stuff and I got them for disc golf and they work great . As long as the waterproof holds up like my hikers did I’ll be so happy . They do run a bit small so I’d go a half size up , I had to return and reorder . Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Maintained Trails with occasional Bouldering
customer_reviews.text: Because the toe box is made from such a hard rubber (for Bouldering), would recommend going up 1/2 size to protect toes from unforgiving crowding. Soles are flexible / thin enough to where you will feel loose gravel in the trail. The trade off - these are really light weight and super comfortable. My experience with Vasque is that they are very durable - that is why I went with 5 stars. If these blow apart after a month, will update this rating.
customer_reviews.author: KeoghTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Color is definitely black.
customer_reviews.text: Fine in all regards except that the overall impression of the color is very prominently black. I was expecting more of the grays to standout based on a close-up view of the shoe. The smaller image clearly shows a black shoe, and that is what you will get.
customer_reviews.author: R. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Superb comfort and grip
customer_reviews.text: I seldom write reviews, but have been really impressed by these shoes. Right out of the box, I found them very comfortable and true to size. I've worn them on several dry hikes on steep, rocky terrain and the grip from the vibram treads is exceptional. I have not tested the waterproof-ness, yet. They feel well-made too but of course only time will tell on that.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Campbell

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I wear these shoes often because of their comfort and style. I love the way a functional shoe can also look so amazing and you'll never have a peeling sole or ripped stitching with these. The soles also last and perform exceptionally well. The Vibram is strong and sticky and found it gripping flat kitchen tile and sticking somewhat, but that's a good sign when no amount of dirt or dust will keep it from clinging to a surface. Ready to hike!
customer_reviews.author: Timmay!

customer_reviews.title: Runs small!  But great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Like the look of this shoe. Does run small. Had to return for a half size larger. Company was very quick on return and delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: Very tight toe box! Returning for half size up hopefully it will be better.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Heel slip x2
customer_reviews.text: I saw another prominent review mention hell slip, wish I paid more attention to that one as these shows barely stay on my feet laced. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rumack

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoe!
customer_reviews.text: For me personally, a 9 usually does the trick. Had to swap these out for a 10. But man am I glad I did. So light, excellent grip, and the huge arches are so comfortable. The trails I spend the most time on are extremely rocky and these bred a lot of confidence on the tough stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good with these hiking shoes. Comfortable, waterproof, lightweight, and fit good with sports orthotics.
customer_reviews.author: Reed Ramlow

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: lightweight, comparable price, a bit tight, good amount of padding, great traction, looks good; updated - heel slip
customer_reviews.author: barry pham

customer_reviews.title: Little plastic saw in heel
customer_reviews.text: Would not buy again. Product runs small and narrow. Poor quality control, rear heel seam on one shoe acts like a little plastic saw, chewed through the sock and raised a blister on a 2 mike walk. I can cover the seam with 25 cents of moleskin but at the cost of these shoes I shouldn't need to.
customer_reviews.author: rodT

customer_reviews.title: The sizing is normal
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why so many reviewers say these run small. I normally wear an 11, but because of the reviews I ordered an 11.5. They were too big, so I had to return and order size 11. The 11s just arrived and fit great. Haven't had a chance yet to wear in the rain, but I can say they are beautiful and comfortable shoes.
customer_reviews.author: M's fan 4000

customer_reviews.title: Best Hiking boot out there
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried many different brands of hiking boot as I wear them daily for my job. Vasquez by far the best and most comfortable. The waterproofing last 2-3 times longer than any other as well.
customer_reviews.author: Me1986

customer_reviews.title: Color not as expected
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are more of an an olive green than a brown as pictured. Still a good color but don't expect a brown shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have several pairs of Vasque shoes, they are all comfortable and well built. Haven't had this latest pair long enough to give serious feedback....
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for my husband. He had the model below this, non gortex, 2x and he loves these too. Does take a bit longer to break in because of the gortex.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha M

customer_reviews.title: Build quality and comfort
customer_reviews.text: This are great shoes! Second pair of Vasque I have bought for work shoes, The first pair lasted 2 years, I typically get about 6 months with a "good shoe". Definitely not just for hiking...
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: width size
customer_reviews.text: Don't order if you need a wide size and it you have a small foot. Some sizes have wide size, but many do not. Regular width is definitely too narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loved these, after sizing up
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are wonderful - I had to send back my 11 and go up to an 11.5 but I live these and may order them in another color because I was so impressed
customer_reviews.author: Tara Tickenoff

customer_reviews.title: comfort is perfect
customer_reviews.text: The bottom tread pattern may be hard to clean if you walk through the mud. Don't walk in the mud! Got it.
customer_reviews.author: Rich D

customer_reviews.title: They are very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The shoelaces do not stay tied -they untied after a short time walking. Other than that, I loved yhem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: comfort
customer_reviews.text: these are even more comfortable that the last pair I had.
customer_reviews.author: rodrigo nino

customer_reviews.title: Size matters
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was a 9 1/2. But with the issues I had to send back and get a nine
customer_reviews.author: Ben Kee

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Got bad knees then this is product for you at the right price
customer_reviews.author: mickey

customer_reviews.title: Broken eyelet
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to like these shoes! Pretty comfortable right out of the box, there was some heel slippage. Waterproof checks out. Here's where things go wrong, I went to tighten the laces, pulled and pop, the eyelet breaks. I had worn these less than 10 times... Pretty bummed, just glad I wasn't on a trail with only these busted shoes. Come on Vasque, skimping on the eyelets......
customer_reviews.author: Disappointed

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable with great traction, the goretex lining is a plus for keeping my feet dry.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: New thing...
customer_reviews.text: These Vasque Breeze LT Low shoes are light and waterproof. There is a defined box to protect your toes. The fit of the shoes is as expected for Vasque. The tread has decent traction. This reviewer did find that the cushioning, especially under the heel, was unusually soft, which may be very disconcerting if you are a heel and toe walker. Worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: HMS Warspite

product_meta.title: Vasque Women's Breeze Lt Low GTX Gore-tex Waterproof Breathable Hiking Shoe
product_meta.description: The breeze lite low gtx is a lightweight, waterproof addition to the beloved breeze line. A lighter successor to the breeze iii low, the lt low features Vibram Mega grip for sure footing across varying surfaces. Supplementing all-weather traction, The lt also features cutting edge Vibram lite base technology, saving 25% in outsole weight. A synthetic microfiber upper provides all-day breathability, while delivering improved fit for more comfortable trail miles.
